docs.lead_paragraph: IN his autobiography the creator of Sherlock Holmes is revealed as primarily a man of action who incidentally won fame as a writer. Even in the field of psychic speculation, to which he has given himself completely since the war, and which he says will occupy him for the remainder of his life, he sees himself as one who has "brought into it a combative and aggressive spirit which it lacked before."

headline.main: ADVENTURES OF A. CONAN DOYLE; Physician, Detective, Author, Historian, War Correspondent and Spiritualist

docs.abstract: Doyle (Sir), A C, Memories and Adventures
